p.s: The article Hope of escape lost in translation written by Zia Haider Rahman and first published in The Sunday Times on 17th December 2016 deals with the problem that a lot of people coming from Bangladesh into Great Britain does not learn the English language and that they stay close with other people from Bangladesh and does not integrate in the British culture.
The text is divided in four paragraphs.

The first paragraph (cf. ll. 1-4) is about that there is spend much money for people who doesdo not speak English on translating important information for them, than helping them to learn English or to integrate.
Then, the next paragraph (cf. ll. 5-10) deals with the Brick Lane in the East End of London with a high level of criminality.
The following paragraph (cf. ll. 11-17) tells us something about the author's life.
He does not have to grow up in Brick Lane, when he arrived in Britain.
He and his parents wanted to learn English and so they did.
He goes to a normal school and had a normal life.
The fourth and last paragraph is about that everoneeveryone should get the chance to learn by curbing the translation and making English compulsory for all citizens.
